panels.description: Number of disks.
panels.title: Total Disks

panels.description: Number of failed disks.
panels.title: Failed Disks

panels.description: The utilization percent of the disk. aggr_disk_busy is [disk_busy](#disk_busy) aggregated by `aggr`.
panels.title: Raid Groups

panels.description: The utilization percent of the disk. aggr_disk_busy is [disk_busy](#disk_busy) aggregated by `aggr`.
panels.title: Plexes

panels.description: Number of disks in the aggregate.
panels.title: Total Disks by Aggregate(s)

panels.description: Disk capacity per aggregate detail.
panels.title: Disk Capacity Per Aggregate

panels.description: Highest Disk Utilization per Aggregate for latest record (independent of time range selected).
panels.title: Top $TopResources Aggregates by Disk Utilization

panels.description: Highest Disk Utilization per Aggregate in the selected time range.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Aggregates by Max Disk Utilization

panels.description:
Total number of disk operations involving data transfer initiated per second
.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Aggregates by Disk Transfers

panels.description: Average number of blocks transferred in each user read operation. aggr_disk_max_user_read_chain is the maximum of [disk_user_read_chain](#disk_user_read_chain) for label `aggr`.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Aggregates by User Read Chain Length

panels.description: Average number of blocks transferred in each user write operation. aggr_disk_max_user_write_chain is the maximum of [disk_user_write_chain](#disk_user_write_chain) for label `aggr`.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Aggregates by User Write Chain Length

panels.description: Average latency per block in microseconds for user read operations.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Disks by User Read Latency

panels.description: Average latency per block in microseconds for user write operations.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Disks by User Write Latency

panels.description: Total number of disk operations involving data transfer initiated per second.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Disks by Total Transfers

panels.description: The utilization percent of the disk in the selected time range.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Disks by Disk Busy

panels.description: Some Clusters don't report average latency, so the values might be 0s.
panels.title: Disks in Cluster

panels.description: This panel displays detail of number of disk kilobytes (KB) read/written per second.
panels.title: Disk Throughput by Node

panels.description: This panel displays detail of bytes written/read through a host adapter.
panels.title: Disk and Tape Drives Throughput by Node

panels.description: This panel displays detail of bytes written/read through a host adapter.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Disk and Tape Drives Throughput by Host Adapter

panels.description: This panel displays detail of external cache hit rate and estimated number of disk reads per second replaced by cache.
panels.title: Flash Cache

panels.description: This panel displays detail of percentage of HDD read operations replace by SSD and number of HDD read operations replaced by SSD reads per second.
panels.title: Flash Pool

panels.description:
This panel displays details of the counts of two types of Consistency Points (CP).

- **Back-to-Back CP (back_to_back_CP)**: For more information, see [Write Performance Impacted by Back to Back Consistency Points](https://kb.netapp.com/on-prem/ontap/Perf/Perf-KBs/Write_Performance_Impacted_by_Back_to_Back_Consistency_Points).
- **Deferred Back-to-Back CP (deferred_back_to_back_CP)**: For more information, see [What are the different Consistency Point types and how are they measured](https://kb.netapp.com/on-prem/ontap/Perf/Perf-KBs/What_are_the_different_Consistency_Point_types_and_how_are_they_measured).
panels.title: CP (Consistency Points) Counts

panels.description: This panel displays details of the average latency in microseconds for the WAFL filesystem to process write requests to the volume.
panels.title: Write Latency by Node
